document_data.name: Uth Myrmoran I
document_data.ethnicity: [[Illuskan]]<ref group="note">Tavaray was settled by Illuskans from [[Ruathym]] and Uth I was a lord of that city before his exile. Therefore it is assumed he was of Illuskan descent. See ''[[The Grand History of the Realms]]'' pp. 59 and 63.
document_data.mainbody: King '''Uth Myrmoran I''' was a [[human]] of [[Illuskan]] descent who constructed [[Uthtower]] and became the self-proclaimed king of a small port settlement on the [[Sword Coast North]] in the {{YearlinkName|146}}. The realm was named Uthtower after the newly built seat of power.
document_data.Relationships: Uth I's consort was Queen [[Sarlani Myrmoran|Sarlani]] and their eldest son and heir was [[Ornoth I|Ornoth Myrmoran I]].
document_data.History:
Uth I was a Lord of [[Tavaray]] until he was exiled. He moved to a small port settlement in the region south of [[Leilon]] and, in 146 DR, he built Uthtower on a rocky hill near the coast.{{Cite dungeon/73/Eye of Myrkul|25}} He brought a company of [[Shoon]] mercenaries with him, and proclaimed himself king, intending to build a great realm from this first settlement. He had brought with him a great deal of personal wealth from Tavaray and used this to pay off anyone who was opposed to him seizing power.

Uth I began to feel the effects of age around [[158 DR]] and allowed his eldest son [[Ornoth I|Ornoth Myrmoran]] to run the government. He died a decade later in the {{YearlinkName|168}}.

King Uth I's and Queen Sarlani's crypts were located below the ruins of the Uthtower in what eventually became the [[Mere of Dead Men]].
